memberdef.name: ImuSimulator

briefdescription.para: Constructor of the ImuSimulator class.

parameterdescription.para: IMU simulation parameters for the accelerometer.
IMU simulation parameters for the gyroscope.
IMU model enable settings.
Geodetic position of the IMU (latitude, longitude, height) (rad,rad,m).

briefdescription.para: Destructor of the ImuSimulator class.
Generates an erroneous accelerometer measurement vector.

detaileddescription.para:
This function generates an erroneous accelerometer measurement vector. The measurement vector is generated by applying the following models:
gravity model,
scale factor,
misalignment model,
constant turn-on bias model,
stochastic error model,
saturation model,
quantization model.

parameterdescription.para: True acceleration of body frame with respect to inertial frame.
True quaternion of body frame with respect to navigation frame.

briefdescription.para: Generates an erroneous gyroscope measurement vector.

detaileddescription.para:
This function generates an erroneous gyroscope measurement vector. The measurement vector is generated by applying the following models:
Earth angular velocity model,
scale factor,
misalignment model,
constant turn-on bias model,
stochastic error model,
saturation model,
quantization model.

parameterdescription.para: True angular velocity of body frame with respect to navigation (NED) frame.
True quaternion of body frame with respect to navigation frame.

briefdescription.para: Prints the IMU simulation parameters.

simplesect.para: String stream with the IMU simulation parameters.

briefdescription.para: Gravity model for IMU acceleration measurements.

detaileddescription.para: An accelerometer measures the sum of the true acceleration of the body frame and the gravity vector (specific force). The true specific force is calculated by subtracting the gravity vector from the true acceleration.

parameterdescription.para: True acceleration of body frame with respect to inertial frame.
True quaternion of body frame with respect to navigation frame.

simplesect.para: True specific force of body frame with respect to inertial frame.

briefdescription.para: Model for ideal gyroscope angular velocity measurements.

detaileddescription.para: A gyroscope measures the true angular velocity of the body with respect to the inertial frame. Earth is rotating with an angular velocity, which needs to be added to the true angular velocity. The rotation of the navigation frame with respect to Earth also needs to be considered (transport angular velocity).

parameterdescription.para: True angular velocity of body frame with respect to NED frame.
True quaternion of body frame with respect to navigation frame.

simplesect.para: True angular velocity of body frame with respect to inertial frame.

briefdescription.para: Calculate the gravity vector in the navigation frame at a given latitude and height.

detaileddescription.para:
This function calculates the local gravity vector in the navigation (NED) frame using the European WELMEC gravity model at a given latitude and height.
WELMEC Guide
geoPositionLlh
Geodetic position (latitude, longitude, height) of body frame (IMU)
Local gravity vector in the navigation frame (m/s).

briefdescription.para: Calculate the angular velocity of Earth in the navigation frame at a given latitude.

detaileddescription.para:
This function calculates the angular velocity of Earth in the navigation (NED) frame at a given latitude.
Aided Navigation - GPS with High Rate Sensors
geoPositionLlh
Geodetic position (latitude, longitude, height) of body frame (IMU)
Angular velocity vector of Earth in the navigation frame (rad/s).

briefdescription.para: Calculate the transport angular velocity in the navigation frame.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the transport angular velocity in the navigation (NED) frame.

parameterdescription.para: Geodetic position (latitude, longitude, height) of body frame (IMU)
Velocity of the body (b) frame with respect to the ECEF (e) frame (m/s).

simplesect.para: Transport angular velocity vector in the navigation (NED) frame (rad/s).

briefdescription.para: Turn-on bias (constant bias) model for IMU measurements.

detaileddescription.para: An IMU shows a constant bias which changes every time the IMU is turned on. This function adds the constant turn-on bias to the measurement vector. The constant turn-on bias is drawn from a uniform distribution at class initialization.

parameterdescription.para: Vector of IMU measurements (acceleration or angular velocity).
Measurement type (acceleration or angular velocity).

simplesect.para: Measurement vector with added constant turn-on bias.

briefdescription.para: Scaling error model for IMU measurements.

detaileddescription.para: Scaling errors result from imperfect calibration of the sensor's scaling factor. Since the sensor's onboard software already attempts to compensate for these errors, this function is meant to apply only to the uncompensated part.

parameterdescription.para: Vector of IMU measurements (acceleration or angular velocity).
Scale factors in all three dimensions (%).

simplesect.para: Measurement vector with scaling error.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector3d &measurement, const Eigen::Matrix< double, 6, 1 > &nonOrthogonality, const Eigen::Vector3d &misAlignment)
memberdef.name: calcMisalignmentModel

briefdescription.para: Misalignment and orthogonality error model for IMU measurements.

detaileddescription.para: The IMU's measurements are subject to two further types of errors: Non-orthogonality means that each of the axes can be tilted w.r.t. its perfect orthogonal position independently from other axes (in addition to misalignment). misalignment represents a rigid-body (orthogonal) rotational misplacement of The actual sensor axes with their locations marked on the sensor. This function applies all three of these errors to the measurement. Since the The sensor's onboard software already attempts to compensate for these errors; this function is meant to apply only to the uncompensated part.

parameterdescription.para: Vector of IMU measurements (acceleration or angular velocity).
Six angles between each pair of the axes (rad).
Three Euler angles representing the rigid-body rotation (rad).

simplesect.para: Measurement vector with misalignment and orthogonality error.

briefdescription.para: Stochastic error model for IMU measurements.

detaileddescription.para: This function adds the stochastic error to each axis of the measurement vector. The detailed implementation is in function calcDiscreteTimeEquivalentModel().

parameterdescription.para: Vector of IMU measurements (acceleration or angular velocity).
Measurement type (acceleration or angular velocity).
Matrix of normal distributed random numbers.

simplesect.para: Measurement vector with added stochastic error.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::shared_ptr< ImuStochasticErrors > pImuStochasticErrors, const double N, const double B, const double K, const double corrTime, const AxisIdentifier axisId)
memberdef.name: updateDiscreteTimeEquivalentStateSpaceModel

briefdescription.para: Discrete-time equivalent (NBK) model of a Gauss-Markov process to model stochastic errors.

detaileddescription.para:
This function calculates the discrete-time equivalent (NBK) model using a first-order Gauss-Markov process. An IMU shows stochastic errors which sum up to colored noise, modeled as:
velocity/angle random walk (N),
bias instability (B),
acceleration/rate random walk (K). The internal Gauss-Markov state space model is updated with these parameters if this function is called. The model has internal states for time-correleated bias instability and acceleration/rate random walk. The white noise velocity/angle random walk is added at the end to the internal states. The output of the Gauss-Markov model is then the sum of all noise components which yields colored noise. The function returns the colored noise for one axis as double (scalar).
Inertial Measurement Unit Error Modeling Tutorial
pImuStochasticErrors
Pointer to struct of IMU stochastic error states.
N
Velocity/angle random walk.
B
Bias instability.
K
Accel./rate random walk.
corrTime
Correlation time of Gauss-Markov error model.
normDistNumbers
Vector of normal distributed random numbers.
axisId
Axis identifier.
Sum of noise states (colored noise).

briefdescription.para: Saturation model for IMU measurements.

detaileddescription.para: This function saturates the measurement vector to the absolute values of the measRange vector. This replicates that an IMU can only measure values within a certain range.

parameterdescription.para: Vector of IMU measurements (acceleration or angular velocity).
Vector of measurement ranges (acceleration or angular velocity).

simplesect.para: Saturated measurement vector.

briefdescription.para: Quantization model for IMU measurements.

detaileddescription.para: This function quantizes the measurement vector to the resolution of the resolution vector. This replicates that an IMU can only measure values with a certain resolution (Analog/Digital conversion).

parameterdescription.para: Vector of IMU measurements (acceleration or angular velocity).
Vector of measurement resolutions (acceleration or angular velocity).

simplesect.para: Quantized measurement vector.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the IMU constant errors.

detaileddescription.para:
This function initializes the IMU constant errors by drawing random numbers from a uniform distribution. The following IMU constant errors are initialized:
constant turn-on bias,
scale factor and misalignment.

briefdescription.para: Draws a random number from a normal distribution.

detaileddescription.para: This function draws a random number from a normal distribution with the given mean and standard deviation.

simplesect.para: Single random number from the normal distribution.

briefdescription.para: Draws a random number from a uniform distribution.

detaileddescription.para: This function draws a random number from a uniform distribution in a given interval [-interval, +interval].

parameterdescription.para: Interval of the uniform distribution.

simplesect.para: Single random number from the uniform distribution.
